intro.paragraph1: Personal data (usually referred to just as "data" below) will only be processed by us to the extent necessary and for the purpose of providing a functional and user-friendly website, including its contents, and the services offered there.
intro.paragraph2: Per Art. 4 No. 1 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679, i.e. the General Data Protection Regulation (hereinafter referred to as the "GDPR"), "processing" refers to any operation or set of operations such as collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation, alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination, or otherwise making available, alignment, or combination, restriction, erasure, or destruction performed on personal data, whether by automated means or not.
intro.paragraph3: The following privacy policy is intended to inform you in particular about the type, scope, purpose, duration, and legal basis for the processing of such data either under our own control or in conjunction with others. We also inform you below about the third-party components we use to optimize our website and improve the user experience which may result in said third parties also processing data they collect and control.

structure.intro: Our privacy policy is structured as follows:
structure.item1: Information about us as controllers of your data
structure.item2: The rights of users and data subjects

section1.title: I. Information about us as controllers of your data
section1.description: The party responsible for this website (the "controller") for purposes of data protection law is:
section1.name: Michael Buschmann

section2.title: II. The rights of users and data subjects
section2.intro: With regard to the data processing to be described in more detail below, users and data subjects have the right
section2.right1: to confirmation of whether data concerning them is being processed, information about the data being processed, further information about the nature of the data processing, and copies of the data (cf. also Art. 15 GDPR);
section2.right2: to correct or complete incorrect or incomplete data (cf. also Art. 16 GDPR);
section2.right3: to the immediate deletion of data concerning them (cf. also Art. 17 DSGVO), or, alternatively, if further processing is necessary as stipulated in Art. 17 Para. 3 GDPR, to restrict said processing per Art. 18 GDPR;
section2.right4: to receive copies of the data concerning them and/or provided by them and to have the same transmitted to other providers/controllers (cf. also Art. 20 GDPR);
section2.right5: to file complaints with the supervisory authority if they believe that data concerning them is being processed by the controller in breach of data protection provisions (see also Art. 77 GDPR).
section2.additional1: In addition, the controller is obliged to inform all recipients to whom it discloses data of any such corrections, deletions, or restrictions placed on processing the same per Art. 16, 17 Para. 1, 18 GDPR. However, this obligation does not apply if such notification is impossible or involves a disproportionate effort. Nevertheless, users have a right to information about these recipients.
section2.additional2: Likewise, under Art. 21 GDPR, users and data subjects have the right to object to the controller's future processing of their data pursuant to Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. f) GDPR. In particular, an objection to data processing for the purpose of direct advertising is permissible.

section3.title: III. Information about the data processing
section3.intro: Your data processed when using our website will be deleted or blocked as soon as the purpose for its storage ceases to apply, provided the deletion of the same is not in breach of any statutory storage obligations or unless otherwise stipulated below.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: If you contact us via email or the contact form, the data you provide will be used for the purpose of processing your request. We must have this data in order to process and answer your inquiry; otherwise we will not be able to answer it in full or at all.
contact.legalBasis: The legal basis for this data processing is Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. b) GDPR.
contact.deletion: Your data will be deleted once we have fully answered your inquiry and there is no further legal obligation to store your data, such as if an order or contract resulted therefrom.

disclaimer.title: Some thoughts on responsibility
disclaimer.paragraph1: I firmly believe that as developers and designers alike, we have a duty to ensure that our products do no harm. I strive to maintain high ethical standards in the projects I undertake.
disclaimer.paragraph2: If your organization is involved in online gambling, payday loans, big tobacco, or monetizing personal data, I might not be the right fit for your project. Additionally, due to the significant energy consumption associated with crypto technology, I avoid projects in that area. While I don't completely dismiss any technology, I can't in good conscience work with it in its current state. I may reconsider if it becomes genuinely carbon-neutral beyond simple offsetting, but until then, I'm not the right person for such projects.
disclaimer.paragraph3: That said, if you're seeking to develop something that fosters sustainability, diversity, or generally aims to have a positive impact, let's link up and figure how we can achieve this together.
